snippet: Capt. Simratpal Singh says the Army’s granting of a permanent accommodation for a turban and a religious beard means that he can finally fit “two parts of my world together.”
abstract: Q&A interview with United States Army Capt Simratpal Singh, who has been granted permission to wear religious beard and turban in uniform; Singh went through prolonged legal fight with Army to finally win permission to wear beard and turban, in accordance with customs of his Sikh faith.
lead_paragraph: Capt. Simratpal Singh says the Army’s granting of a permanent accommodation for a turban and a religious beard means that he can finally fit “two parts of my world together.”

headline.main: Sikh Captain Says Keeping Beard and Turban Lets Him Serve U.S. and Faith
headline.print_headline: Why Decorated Officer Sued Army Over Beard
